comments.body: We are better off pulling from the pypi source https://pypi.org/project/unidiff/.
The pypi sources do not contain unit tests, which is probably a bug, but still it makes the pypi source not as useful for this package. I'll open an issue on the unidiff repo.
Just made a PR: https://github.com/matiasb/python-unidiff/pull/61 PRs don't get merged quickly on this repo, so I'd rather not wait for it if you don't mind. Thanks for reviewing.

It is ok for now. I don't consider running unit tests in the conda build needed. We are testing if a python package is installed properly here. An import does the trick. If the package does not work, that is an issue for the upstream package.
